columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the alarm.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

columns.name: state_value
columns.description: The state value for the alarm.

columns.name: actions_enabled
columns.description: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state.

columns.name: alarm_configuration_updated_timestamp
columns.description: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm configuration.

columns.name: alarm_description
columns.description: The description of the alarm.

columns.name: comparison_operator
columns.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold. The specified statistic value is used as the first operand.

columns.name: datapoints_to_alarm
columns.description: The number of data points that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

columns.name: evaluate_low_sample_count_percentile
columns.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles.

columns.name: evaluation_periods
columns.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

columns.name: extended_statistic
columns.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

columns.name: metric_name
columns.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm, if this is an alarm based on a single metric.

columns.name: namespace
columns.description: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm.

columns.name: period
columns.description: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

columns.name: state_reason
columns.description: An explanation for the alarm state, in text format.

columns.name: state_reason_data
columns.description: An explanation for the alarm state, in JSON format.

columns.name: state_updated_timestamp
columns.description: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm state.

columns.name: statistic
columns.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile.

columns.name: threshold
columns.description: The value to compare with the specified statistic.

columns.name: threshold_metric_id
columns.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

columns.name: treat_missing_data
columns.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. If this parameter is omitted, the default behavior of missing is used.

columns.name: unit
columns.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

columns.name: alarm_actions
columns.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

columns.name: dimensions
columns.description: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm.

columns.name: insufficient_data_actions
columns.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

columns.name: metrics
columns.description: An array of MetricDataQuery structures, used in an alarm based on a metric math expression.

columns.name: ok_actions
columns.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: The list of tag keys and values associated with alarm.
